And I think that the Democrats should continue this. Because it guarantees the president will be re-elected. I think he will be reelected. It's certainly something they -- no one should take for granted. There's a lot of things going on with Americans right now, the news today in Iran of course, the Strait of Hormuz. The world is very -- getting very disturbed and the nation has to be governed. The signaling that this sends to the world is that there's turmoil here and it affects also our national security. So I think that this is something the Democrats if they were serious would stop. Are you happy with what this is going to look like?

utterances.speaker: SMIKLE

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM

I think in some ways there's some argument that maybe Elizabeth Warren is disadvantaged a little bit because of who she's on with and when she's on. utterances.sentences: Mark my words. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Thank you for being here. Coming up next, critics slam Sarah Huckabee Sanders as she prepares to leave her post as White House Press Secretary.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, her legacy is one of defending the indefensible and not being truthful with the American people.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Governor Mike Huckabee who as you might imagine didn't take kindly to that will join me in just a moment. We're also going to talk about the escalating tensions with Iran. Big story tonight coming up next. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well, Iran did do it and you know they did it because you saw the boat. I guess one of the mines didn't explode and it's probably got essentially Iran written all over it. They're a nation of terror.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: It's a tense situation. President Trump saying that Iran is behind the attacks on oil tankers near the Straits of Hormuz. The administration pointing to this intelligence video, very fascinating to take a look at this. It was taken obviously overnight. It shows the Iranian National Guard pulling up to alongside the tanker and removing, pulling a magnet mine off of the side of one of those tanks as it's proof. But Iran denies these charges. Tensions are quickly mounting. National Security Correspondent Jennifer Griffin has the backstory.

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER GRIFFIN, NATIONAL SECURITY CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Martha, officials say the unexploded limpet mine removed from the tanker is the same type of mine used to attack four oil tankers last month in the same area. The Secretary of State also blamed Iran for those attacks. U.S. Central Command released this photo showing what it says is the unexploded mine attached to the hull of one of the tankers attacked Thursday. This video also released by the U.S. military shows what it claims is proof of Iran's involvement in the attacks. Officials say this Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guard fast boat were the ones to remove that unexploded mine from the hull. Iran denies it played any role in the attacks.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Jennifer. Joining me now former Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee, a former presidential candidate and Fox News Contributor. Governor, good to see you tonight. Obviously, you've been a very outspoken supporter of Israel. You've been to the Middle East many times. What's your take on what Iran hopes the outcome of this provocation will be?

utterances.speaker: MIKE HUCKABEE, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I cannot even begin to imagine unless they're poking at the bear just to see what the United States and other countries will do. But it's ridiculous for them to claim they had nothing to do with it. It's like who you going to believe, Iran or your lying eyes. I mean there's the tape. It's clear what they're doing. But this is a region in a country, in a regime that has been so dishonest, and they've been so brutal not only to their enemies like Israel and the rest of the world but also to their own people. But I think the president is playing this right. He's not rushing into military action which would be a huge mistake. He is being very careful and calculating. But I think he is also being very clear that this kind of behavior is not something that the rest of the world, not just the U.S. is going to sit back and tolerate.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Well, it's clearly a tense situation and something that the president will have to monitor very closely in the coming days and weeks. Let me turn your attention to another issue, which is the resignation of your daughter from her job as press secretary at the White House. She has been getting, you know, a lot of very strong comments about her tenure there and this one comes from President Obama's former top advisor David Axelrod. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, FORMER SENIOR ADVISER, OBAMA ADMINISTRATION
utterances.sentences: If you are the spokesperson for a habitual liar, it's like being fire marshal for a pyromaniac. You know, it's not going to end well for you. In this job, she was called upon to choose between her fidelity to Trump and her fidelity to the truth. And she chose Trump. I mean her legacy is one of defending the indefensible.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I mean, you know, Sean Spicer got the same kind of treatment --

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: -- and your daughter Sarah Huckabee Sanders also lined up for it when she took over.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Well, the truth is people that don't like Donald Trump don't like my daughter. And it's not that they don't like her because most of them don't even know her, they just don't like President Trump and that's unfortunate because a lot of us do like him and we are grateful for what he is doing. I'm a little surprised that this came out of Axelrod. He is a better person than that he knows better. And I am really shocked and surprised that he would go there to that degree. But, again, he is a CNN contributor. What is he going to do? They pay people to hate President Trump. That's what they pay them to do. So, I guess he earned his paycheck on that particular segment.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I know you've heard the talk and I think you commented on it a little while ago about what she might do next. You are the former governor of Arkansas. And there is some discussion that perhaps she would like to follow in your footsteps to the state house. What would you say to that?

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Well, I would be thrilled to death if she decided to do that, she probably is the only person ever moving into the governor's mansion who had lived there before who spent most of her growing up there. So, I think it would be kind of interesting. She knows where all the bodies are buried. I think she helped bury some quite frankly.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: What do you mean by that?

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: But I don't know what she's going -- you know, I don't know what she is going to do. I frankly don't think she knows either. Because she hasn't had time to come up for air in the past three or four years.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: So, she is going to spend some time with her children. She is going to kind of reassess. Decide what's next but I can tell you this. She is so grateful to the president for the opportunity she had. And if anybody wonders, I can assure you she loves this president very loyal to him, didn't leave for any negative. She just left because it's a tough job and she's got three small children --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: It sure is.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: -- and thought it was the good time to make the move.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes. She's done an enormous amount of travel and she has put in excruciating hours and done so without any complaint about it. She is a very hard worker, and the president I know it feels very strongly about having her there. You know, just real quick before I let you go. He's also said speaking of loyalty that he is not going to, you know, encourage Kellyanne Conway to leave based on what a watchdog agency has determined are Hatch Act violations. What do you say to that?

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he has taken the right position. Kellyanne like everybody else in the administration is under just scrutiny to a level that is unprecedented. And I really think it's ridiculous to say what Kellyanne has said violates the Hatch Act. And it's unfortunate that she is being targeted like that. I think the president is right to stand his ground and stand by his people because, when he does that there is so much more likely to stand by him. And they do.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Governor, thank you very much. Good to see you tonight. Governor --

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Martha. Great to be with you.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Governor Huckabee. Good to be with you.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Coming up right now a special edition of lady's night. Plus, the newly unearthed video that seems to say how Joe Biden really feels about abortion.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: So pop star Ariana Grande has donated $250,000 the proceeds of the recent Atlanta concert to Planned Parenthood in response to Georgia's restrictive abortion laws. The issue is a hot topic among -- among 2020 Democrats. Many promising to be champions of a woman's right to choose. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND, D-N.Y., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Autonomy for our body in this country.

utterances.speaker: SEN. AMY KLOBUCHAR, D-MINN., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: We cannot allow them to move this country backwards.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: We will not stand for this kind of attack on human rights.

utterances.speaker: BOOKER
utterances.sentences: This kind of attack on women's rights.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: So that from three of the prominent candidates. But this newly unearthed video from 2006 shows then Senator Joe Biden taking a very different stance. Grappling with his support for Roe v. Wade, even calling abortion a tragedy. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: See, I'm a little, I'm a bit of odd man out in my party. I do not view abortion as a choice and a right. I think it's always a tragedy. And I think that it should be rare and safe. And I think we should be focusing on how to limit the number of abortions and there ought to be able to have a common ground and consensus how to do that.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Here now Lila Rose, Live Action founder and president, and Rochelle Ritchie, former press secretary for the House Democrats. Great to have both of you with us. Rochelle, let me start with you. You know, when I listen to that old sound bite, fairly old 2006 from former Vice President Joe Biden, it sounds a lot to me like most Democrats used to sound on the issue of abortion.

utterances.speaker: ROCHELLE RITCHIE, DEMOCRATIC STRATEGIST
utterances.sentences: Yes. And, you know, it's a sound bite that's from 13 years ago. And I think there was another comment that he made in 1974. So, we're really talking about comments that have been made over a lot of time. And I think that you know, a candidate has been the opportunity to evolve and clearly, he evolved from 1974 to 2006. And I think this is exactly where Biden needs to stay. He needs to stay in the middle of the road. He needs to be true to his values. He doesn't need to get into this whole fight about the Hyde Amendment. He needs to stay true to who he is. So, I don't see a problem with the comments that he made if that is his truth.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes. Lila, you know is, Joe Biden, is he drifting, I guess, is one of the questions because we saw his overturn on the Hyde Amendment. It was a lot of confusion about it. It suggested that he, you know, was changing his mind about federal funding for abortion and that maybe he felt like it had to be supported now and then he said no, that's not what I said and then he said yes, that is what I said. What is going on here? LILA ROSE, FOUNDER & PRESIDENT, LIVE ACTION: Right. I mean he is a flip flopper, Joe Biden, he's just like everybody else now in the field in the Democratic Party running for -- running to be the nominee for president. They all are extreme on abortion. Out of touch with the vast majority of Americans. This isn't evolving on abortion. This is regressing on abortion. Look, most Americans want abortion restrictions. Seventy percent of millennials and gen-z want abortion to be banned until the first trimester or banned all together. So, this idea of these Democrats that abortion should be legal through all nine months for any reason, funded by the taxpayer, funded by anybody, everybody, is really repugnant to most Americans.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: So, I think this is not going to --

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: Martha --

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: -- bode well for Joe Biden. He's just like everybody else and he is a flip flopper.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, Rochelle.

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: Martha, that's just not true. Actually, there are polls out there that show more than 50 percent of Democrats do not support -- they support abortion but they don't support using federal funds for those abortions. So that's just not -- that's just not true. I don't think that --

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: But that's exactly right, they don't support federal funds for abortion.

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: Right. Isn't that what you want? You don't want us to use federal funds for abortion, right?

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: But Joe Biden wants federal funds to be used for abortion.

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: He is saying that now. But you said that -- you said that a lot of Democrats.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: You know, Harris --

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: You said 70 percent want that and that's not true.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I think it's going to be very interesting to see --

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: Bernie Sanders all in support of funding abortion.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes. Hold on. I want to -- I think it is going to be interesting to see where Joe Biden stands on this going forward and if he sticks to his most recent sort of evolution on this topic because I think Rochelle makes a great point. Because when you do look at the polls, there is a lot of support for people who are more in the middle on this issue. And it has sort of become the party line among Democrats that unless you are pro-choice, there is no room in the party for pro-life Democrats. Kirsten Gillibrand has said that very clearly. Then you see sort of on the Hollywood and music level, Ariana Grande giving the money that she gave because in Georgia they have adopted more harsh abortion laws that is the debate that has been shaping up. I want to ask you before I let you go about Live Action which is your organization, Lila Rose, which is against abortion. You had some ads or some postings that were pulled off of Instagram. What were they and why did they do that?

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: Sure. So, it was Pinterest which is a popular --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Pinterest, excuse me.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: -- picture sharing company, social media platform. And there was a whistle blower that came out just a few days ago saying we had been added to the porn block list that Live Action. So, all of our images of ultrasound. I mean, images that pregnant expecting mothers share, images sharing facts on abortion that they had been banned from Pinterest when the whistle blower came out, he was insider and employee at Pinterest. Pinterest actually fired him and then completely suspended Live Action's life-affirming account. And so now we can't post any content to Pinterest. Meanwhile Pinterest, the social media tech company, allows abortion clinics and Planned Parenthood to post abortion ads.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: Selling abortions on the platform.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: All right. We got to leave it there.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: So, it's pretty horrific bias.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Lila Rose. Yes, it's very -- it's an interesting debate obviously. Lila Rose and Rochelle Ritchie, good to see both of you tonight. Thank you very much, ladies.

utterances.speaker: RITCHIE
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Martha.

utterances.speaker: ROSE
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Martha.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: So, is the key to a happy marriage living in two different places? Our lady's night panel debates what is a little bit of a growing trend out there.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Your wife handles a lot of the family expenses and the campaign finances so are you saying it's more her fault than your fault?

utterances.speaker: REP. DUNCAN HUNTER, R-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm saying when I went to Iraq in 2003, the first time I gave her power of attorney and she handled my finances throughout my entire military career and that continued on when I got into Congress. Because I'm gone five days a week, I'm home for two. So, she was also the campaign manager. So, whatever she did that will be looked at too, I'm sure. But I didn't do it.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Wow, do you remember that? That was pretty incredible. He basically threw his wife under the bus in that interview. And now Congressman Duncan Hunter is once again sort of passing the buck to his wife amid charges that they misused campaign funds for personal use. Margaret Hunter has now pleaded guilty to knowingly and willfully converting those funds, admitting to spending the money on things like this. A $10,000 trip to Italy, a flight for rabbit whose name is Eggburt. Zip lining excursion for Duncan and their kids, and a $351 lunch for the family. Here's now lady's night, Lisa Boothe, Jessica Tarlov, and Susan Li. You know, when I look at that and she pled guilty, you know, maybe it was all her fault, Lisa.

utterances.speaker: LISA BOOTHE, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, we will see what happens happening for Duncan Hunter. But assume he is feeling the heat now that she's flipped. But can you blame him? I mean, Martha, I remember when you did that interview with the congressman and we did this ladies panel and talked about it.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: We were all so infuriated. I mean, how despicable just to throw your wife under the bus on that. But I also just think how -- what an arrogant abuse of power to be spending your campaign funds this way. And if you are those individuals who donated or took part in his campaign, what a slap in the face to them.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: What a slap in the face to the office that you hold. It's disgraceful. I really honestly think he should step down. And I assume especially after this and we learn more when the trial begins you are going to see an enormous amount of pressure from Republicans to get him to step aside -- step down.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes. when I hear things like that, Jessica, I just think, it just makes me wonder why anyone gives to campaigns honestly.

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Because I think there is a lot of this kind of sentiment that well, you know, it all has to support me and my life because if my life is supported then I'm going to be a better candidate. I mean, it's all kinds of ways to justify this stuff.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: This is also to the absolute extreme. I'm all for having conversations about how much elected officials should be paid and people who work in these offices who want to make sure that they get a living wage. But Duncan Hunter knew when their bunny rabbit was on the plane with them - -

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- there was a problem. And that when he was in Italy or having that lunch that there was an issue. I mean, he also he grew up in a household his father held the seat before him.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's very familiar how it all works.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: He knows about how much people in public service make, how they should be living their lives and I don't know if his father was corrupt as well. But I remember that interview well because we talked about it with you. And the juxtaposition that he wanted to draw with I was over in Iraq serving our country and my wife was back home abusing the public coffers.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Bad dude to merit.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: It was pretty stunning.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: And so, we'll see what happens with the Hunters going forward and, you know, whether or not she is sort of flipping on him at this point. I want to get your thoughts on something completely different which is Gwyneth Paltrow and her --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Very different.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Some of these segues are a little difficult. Gwyneth Paltrow and her husband, newly married husband Brad Falchuk, basically she came out and said that they live separately. They have two different sets of kids from their first marriages and that he spends basically part of the week with his kids at his house and then the other part of the week with her kids at her house. But it's more than that, it's really sort of, their philosophy of how to keep their intimacy strong. And she says she has an intimacy coach who has guided her through all of this. She has a lot of coaches. What do you think, Lisa?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: It must be nice to be that rich. Just like I guess this is the biggest problem she faces.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes, how many house --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I guess this is her version of conscious coupling.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Because she consciously uncoupled from the Coldplay guy Chris Martin --

utterances.speaker: SUSAN LI, FOX BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Chris Martin.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. So, you know, I guess this is her conscious coupling. I thought the objective of marriage was finding someone that you want to spend time with. But, you know, who knows?

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: You need to --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I want to play what Meghan McCain -- play Meghan McCain here and then we're going to go to Susan.

utterances.speaker: MEGHAN MCCAIN, CO-HOST, ABC
utterances.sentences: It seems like rich people stuff. What if you can't afford to have this. Come on, you guys. I mean, I don't try to judge anybody else's marriage because you don't know what goes on and what works for people. But I just -- the rent alone would be enough to make me angry or that stuff. So, I probably wouldn't do it.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Susan.

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: I don't think it's a money thing. I don't think it's rich or poor. It's just a sign of the times. You know, people work in different places. They fly around the world. What about bicoastal relationship. If you live in New York and you have a boyfriend or husband in Los Angeles you are not going to see each other 24/7. But I would prefer to have my own bathroom to be honest. I would probably have my own bed if I had my choice. But I don't see a problem with not spending seven days a week together.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: So, my boyfriend lives in Chicago. So, we actually live this.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But when we're in New York we are in the same place.

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: Same bathroom?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: OK. Two bathrooms. It is important.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It is important but on holiday we are normal people. But it's interesting because they are in the same city though. This isn't a question about bicoastal relationship. He is just up the road. What it does bring up is a conversation about when you're merging families which I know is very difficult --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- for divorced people who they don't want to their kids to necessarily be uprooted and there are a lot of the psychiatrists who say that it's really good for kids to be able to stay in their own room.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: To stay where they've -- I think that's probably what this is.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes, she should talk about that part more.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: But they seem like they have a pretty good marriage.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Godspeed.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I think very, very happy. So, whatever you are doing, Gwyneth, as usual it appears to be working for you. Here is a quick sound bite from Cory Booker who is -- would be, you know, one of the only I think there is two others. James Buchanan and Grover Cleveland who would go to the White House as unmarried man if indeed that happens. But here's what he said.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If elected you would be the first unmarried president in a long, long time there was one before.

utterances.speaker: BOOKER
utterances.sentences: The swearing in isn't until the 21st of January 2021.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: BOOKER
utterances.sentences: You never know what might happen between now and then.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: No. Well, Rosario Dawson was right there in the studio.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I don't like that.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: What do you think?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: It just seems like this is politically motivated like some sort of stunt or something with Senator Booker to be like putting that out there especially with her in the audience, you know, maybe. And what does that mean for her? She is sitting in audience? Like, is this real? Is this political? Does he actually want to marry me? I mean, this is what would be going to my mind --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: She's already been told that his mother would like him to marry her. Which is like, wait, do you want to marry her?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I think Rosario Dawson is plenty in control of this situation. I think it's very cute. I like with (Inaudible) whenever he talks about this the first time where I do have somebody.

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: I think he's like how he is gushy romantic with RuPaul.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LI
utterances.sentences: RuPaul brings romance --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Like a White House wedding.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: All right. You guys, yes, a White House wedding would be fantastic. It would be a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm here for it.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I'm sure he'll seize it.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys. Yes, exactly. Good to see you, guys. More of The Story coming up next.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: Finally, tonight, Notre Dame Cathedral hold a small mass this weekend exactly two months after the devastating fire brought the century's old spire tumbling down and cause catastrophic damage to the iconic landmark. Wow. Remember that moment? The mass is going to take place in a side chapel. No more than 30 people will be in attendance but broadcast on French television for Christians to take part around the world. So pretty good idea to bring attention to that. It keeps tradition with the anniversary of the consecration of the cathedral's altar celebrated every year on June 16. As of this week Notre Dame Foundation has received nearly $18 million donations. Another 425 million pledged by donors in an ambitious effort to get it rebuilt within five years is the dream of President Emmanuel Macron. So, we will see if he can pull it off. That is “The Story” for this Friday night. Have a wonderful weekend, everybody. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
